body:
`upload_rbe_results.py` is failing because there is an `UNKNOWN` result that I didn't expect. Not sure what it means, but here's an example of it happening recently:

[Kokoro invocation](https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/915f02ec-117f-4084-af4d-0c1a64ec4ebf/log)
[Bazel invocation](https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/df260b49-228c-45ad-abc4-9e7f512dc8ec/targets)

From the full logs of the Kokoro invocation:
```
[23,655 / 23,981] 564 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/bad_ssl:bad_ssl_cert_test@poller=epoll1 [27s (2 actions)] ... (200 actions, 199 running)
[24,220 / 24,546] 848 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 44s remote ... (200 actions, 199 running)
[24,947 / 25,273] 1210 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 64s remote ... (200 actions running)
[25,539 / 25,865] 1506 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 87s remote ... (200 actions, 199 running)
[26,459 / 26,785] 1970 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 113s remote ... (200 actions, 199 running)
[27,401 / 27,727] 2437 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 144s remote ... (200 actions running)
[28,567 / 28,893] 3021 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 178s remote ... (200 actions running)
[29,685 / 30,011] 3583 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 219s remote ... (200 actions running)
[30,501 / 30,827] 3988 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 266s remote ... (200 actions, 199 running)
[31,768 / 32,094] 4640 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 319s remote ... (200 actions, 199 running)
[33,187 / 33,507] 5344 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 379s remote ... (200 actions, 199 running)
[34,825 / 35,075] 6145 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 450s remote ... (200 actions, 199 running)
[35,605 / 35,632] 6512 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 533s remote ... (27 actions running)
[35,624 / 35,632] 6521 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 627s remote ... (8 actions running)
[35,629 / 35,632] 6524 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 748s remote ... (3 actions running)
[35,629 / 35,632] 6524 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 895s remote ... (3 actions running)
[35,631 / 35,632] 6525 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 1095s remote
[35,631 / 35,632] 6525 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 1275s remote
[35,631 / 35,632] 6525 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 1515s remote
[35,631 / 35,632] 6525 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 1812s remote
[35,631 / 35,632] 6525 / 6526 tests; Testing //test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv (run 1 of 2); 2097s remote

```

It looks like it gets stuck on `//test/core/end2end:h2_full_test@call_host_override@poller=poll-cv `, but it doesn't timeout properly? As a result, it gets marked as a tool failure and it's marked as an `UNKNOWN` result in the Bazel invocation.
Yes, that's a known issue from Foundry. Could you make the script more robust? Maybe allow for any arbitrary strings.
